briefdescription.para: Initialize 3D wall data and check inputs.

detaileddescription.para: Before calling this function, the offload struct is expected to hold triangle positions as
where first index is for the triangle vertex and second for the triangle itself.
This function fill rest of the offload struct and constructs the octree, while also printing some values as sanity check.
The default octree depth is defined by macro WALL_OCTREE_DEPTH in wall_3d.h.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to offload array containing integers

briefdescription.para: Free offload array and reset parameters.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to offload array containing integers

briefdescription.para: Initialize wall data struct on target.

detaileddescription.para: This function copies the wall parameters from the offload struct to the struct on target and sets the wall data pointers to correct offsets in the offload array.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to data struct on target

detaileddescription.para: Constructs the octree array by iterating through all wall triangles and octree grid to identify triangles belonging to each grid cell.
Constructs the octree array by iterating through all wall triangles and placing them into an octree structure

parameterdescription.para: pointer to array storing what octree cells contain which triangles

memberdef.argsstring: (real r1, real phi1, real z1, real r2, real phi2, real z2, wall_3d_data *wdata, real *w_coll)
memberdef.name: wall_3d_hit_wall

briefdescription.para: Check if trajectory from (r1, phi1, z1) to (r2, phi2, z2) intersects the wall using the octree structure.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to data struct on target
pointer for storing the parameter in P = P1 + w_coll * (P2-P1), where P is the point where the collision occurred.

simplesect.para: id, which is the first element id if hit, zero otherwise

memberdef.argsstring: (real r1, real phi1, real z1, real r2, real phi2, real z2, wall_3d_data *wdata, real *w_coll)
memberdef.name: wall_3d_hit_wall_full

briefdescription.para: Check if trajectory from (r1, phi1, z1) to (r2, phi2, z2) intersects the wall against all triangles.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to data struct on target
pointer for storing the parameter in P = P1 + w_coll * (P2-P1), where P is the point where the collision occurred.

simplesect.para: id is wall element id if hit, zero otherwise*

memberdef.argsstring: (real t1[3], real t2[3], real t3[3], real bb1[3], real bb2[3])
memberdef.name: wall_3d_tri_in_cube

briefdescription.para: Check if any part of a triangle is inside a box.

parameterdescription.para: xyz coordinates of first triangle vertex [m]
xyz coordinates of second triangle vertex [m]
xyz coordinates of third triangle vertex [m]

simplesect.para: zero if not any part of the triangle is within the box

memberdef.argsstring: (real q1[3], real q2[3], real t1[3], real t2[3], real t3[3])
memberdef.name: wall_3d_tri_collision

briefdescription.para: Check if a line segment intersects a triangle.

detaileddescription.para: This routine implements the MÃ¶ller-Trumbore algorithm.

parameterdescription.para: line segment start point xyz coordinates [m]
line segment end point xyz coordinates [m]
xyz coordinates of first triangle vertex [m]
xyz coordinates of second triangle vertex [m]
xyz coordinates of third triangle vertex [m]

simplesect.para: A positive number w which is defined so that vector q1 + w*(q2-q1) is the intersection point. A negative number is returned if no there is no intersection

memberdef.argsstring: (real q1[3], real q2[3], real t1[3], real t2[3], real t3[3], real t4[3])
memberdef.name: wall_3d_quad_collision

briefdescription.para: Check if a line segment intersects a quad (assumed planar)

parameterdescription.para: line segment start point xyz coordinates [m]
line segment end point xyz coordinates [m]
xyz coordinates of first quad vertex [m]
xyz coordinates of second quad vertex [m]
xyz coordinates of third quad vertex [m]
xyz coordinates of fourth quad vertex [m]

simplesect.para: Zero if no intersection, positive number otherwise

detaileddescription.para: 3D wall model where wall consists of small triangles that form a surface mesh. A wall collision happens when a marker intersects a wall triangle's plane. During initialization, the computational model is divided into smaller cell using octree, and wall triangles are divided according to which cell(s) they inhabit. Collision checks are only made with respect to triangles that are in the same cell as the marker.
